com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.core.api

Interface VideoViewApi

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExoSurfaceVideoView, ExoTextureVideoView, NativeSurfaceVideoView, NativeTextureVideoView

    public interface VideoViewApi
    The basic APIs expected in the backing video view implementations to allow us to create an abstraction between the Native (Android) VideoView and the VideoView using the ExoPlayer.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setDrmCallback

        void setDrmCallback(MediaDrmCallback drmCallback)
        Sets the MediaDrmCallback to use when handling DRM for media. This should be called before specifying the videos uri or path
        NOTE: DRM is only supported on API 18 +
        Parameters:
        drmCallback - The callback to use when handling DRM media

        Performs the functionality to stop the video in playback
        Parameters:

      • restart

        boolean restart()
        Prepares the media previously specified for playback. This should only be called after the playback has completed to restart playback from the beginning.
        Returns:
        true if the media was successfully restarted

      • getAvailableTracks

        java.util.Map<ExoMedia.RendererType,TrackGroupArray> getAvailableTracks()
        Retrieves a list of available tracks to select from. Typically trackSelectionAvailable() should be called before this.
        Returns:
        A list of available tracks associated with each track type

      • setRendererEnabled

        void setRendererEnabled(ExoMedia.RendererType type,
                        boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the track associated with the type. Note, by default all tracks are enabled
        Parameters:
        type - The ExoMedia.RendererType to enable or disable the track for
        enabled - true if the track should be enabled.

      • isRendererEnabled

        boolean isRendererEnabled(ExoMedia.RendererType type)
        Return true if at least one renderer for the given type is enabled
        Parameters:
        type - The renderer type
        Returns:
        true if at least one renderer for the given type is enabled

      • setVideoRotation

        void setVideoRotation(int rotation,
                      boolean fromUser)
        Sets the rotation for the Video
        Parameters:
        rotation - The rotation to apply to the video
        fromUser - True if the rotation was requested by the user, false if it is from a video configuration
